@sdouble wrote:

If you want to just say something during the startup, put

log(“Boat.”);

inside of your start() method.

item.title: Help with my script
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

I highly recommend changing your coding style before you get too far into it. Your “style” is difficult to read and will take you longer to find problems. I’ve converted yours to look like my stlye (which I think it pretty close to the standard) so it’s easier to read. I also included the TunePower I mentioned earlier and inserted a semicolon you missed.

public class TunaPower extends script {

	public static String[] commands = {"TunaPower"};

	public static final int Harpoon = 331;
	public static final int FishingSpot = 324;
	public static final int Tuna = 359;
	public static final int SwordFish = 371; //<-- you also forgot this semicolon
	public NPC fishingNPC;



	public boolean start(String cmd, String[] args)	{
		return true;
	}

	public long run(long lastExecuted) {
		return runFish();
	}


	private long runFish() {
		if (inventoryCount() < 27 )	{
			fishingNPC = findNPCByType(FishingSpot);
			atNPC(fishingNPC, "Harpoon");
		}
		return random(1000,2000);
	}

}

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my script
item.dc:creator: @solemage2 solemage2
item.description:
@solemage2 wrote:

Here is a scipt I have but when i try to compile i get these errors
TunaPower.java:1: expected
public class extends script
^
TunaPower.java:40: ‘{’ expected
}
^
2 errors

Tool completed with exit code 1

[code]public class extends script
{

public static String[] commands = {“TunaPower”};

public static final int Harpoon = 331;
public static final int FishingSpot = 324;
public static final int Tuna = 359;
public static final int SwordFish = 371
public NPC fishingNPC;

public boolean start(String cmd, String[] args)
{

return true;

}

public long run(long lastExecuted)
{

return runFish();

}

private long runFish()
{
if (inventoryCount() < 27 )
{
fishingNPC = findNPCByType(FishingSpot);
atNPC(fishingNPC, “Harpoon”);
}
return random(1000,2000);
}

}[/code][br][size=1]Posted at: May 11, 2006, 04:20:49 pm[/size][hr]anyone?
